description:
The erection of a basement and part three and part two
storey school building to provide additional educational
and ancillary residential accommodation for the Hall School,
as shown  on drawing no(s) 1672/PD01A-PD11A, an unnumbered
A4 size lower ground floor plan, HALL/007A/B, 008A/B, 011/C,
012/A & 013, and as described in a Sheppard Robson report
(Ref: Supporting Information July 1995) and letters from
The Hall School dated 3rd November 1995 and 15th December
1995, and as revised by letter dated 4th Decemeber 1995.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The total number of pupils the school accommodates shall
    not exceed 458.

Condition : 2 - The details of the proposed school minibus drop off and
    pick up scheme for pupils shall be submitted to and
    approved by the Council before the building is occupied, and
    the scheme shall continue tooperate whilst the building
    containues to be occupied.

Condition : 3 - The details of any external ventilation equipment to be
    installed on the building hereby approved shall not be
    otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved
    by the Council before the relevant part  of the work is
    begun.

Condition : 4 - The details of the [layout, sections, elevations and facing materials] to be used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development. [Such details shall include proposed slab levels of the building in relation to the existing and proposed levels of the site and the surrounding land.] These parts of the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in strict accordance
    with the landscape strategy (Ref:DFHC/MEL/11.7.95) and
    construction methodology (Ref:DCH/PM/B/17.5.95) as set
    out in the Sheppard Robson report (ref: Supporting
    Information.July 1995).

Condition : 6 - The development shall not be occupied until the whole of the car parking provision shown on the approved drawings is provided. Thereafter the whole of the car parking provision shall be retained and used for no purpose other than for the parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the use of the premises does not add to parking pressures in surrounding streets which would be contrary to policies RE2 [and TR17 if residential] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the building.

Reason: To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to safeguard amenities of adjacent premises in accordance with the requirements of policy TR23 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation. a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case,

Condition : 9 - The residential accommodation hereby approved shall only
    be occupied by school staff and thier familes, and shall
    not be indepentently occupied.

Condition : 10 - In order ro prevent the proposal having a detrimental
    impact on local environmental and traffic conditions.

Condition : 11 - In order for the Council to consider the details of the
    scheme and to be satisfied that the development hereby
    approved does not have a detrimental effect on local
    traffic conditions.

Condition : 12 - To ensure  that the Council is satisfied that the proposal
    will not be detrimental to local residential amenity.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the trees to be retained on the site have
    sufficient protection in the interests of the amenity of
    the area.

Condition : 15 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 16 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 17 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 18 - The residential accommodation is not considered to be of
    a type appropriate for independent occupation, and would
    fail to meet the Council's policies for housing mix.

Condition : 19 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should
    not take place other than between the hours of 08.00am
    to 18.00pm on Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on
    Saturday, with no working on Sunday or Bank Holiday, in
    order to comply with locally enforced standards.
